It's Kusunoki Masashige...and a quite impressive
statue it is...

Nate Ledbetter

--- Christopher West <kitsuno@...> wrote:
> I recently got an email from someone who wants to
> know who the
> samurai statue is outside the imperial palace in
> tokyo in or near the
> gardens. the statue is of a samurai on a horse.
> It's been about 4
> years since I've been there and I don't remember any
> statue... does
> anyone know who this is a statue of?
>
> c.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] samurai statue
messages.msgSnippet: I think that I remember the staue being of Kusonoki Masashige (the large green statue on horseback?) I could be mistaken but that is the main one that I know
messages.messageBody:
I think that I remember the staue being of Kusonoki Masashige (the large
'green' statue on horseback?) I could be mistaken but that is the main one
that I know of in Tokyo. (and outside the Imperial palace)
Ben.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] samurai statue
messages.msgSnippet: ... I believe it s Kusunoki Masashige, a loyalist who died fighting for an imperial restoration in the 14th Century.  Tony
messages.messageBody:
Christopher West wrote:

> I recently got an email from someone who wants to know who the
> samurai statue is outside the imperial palace in tokyo in or near the
> gardens. the statue is of a samurai on a horse. It's been about 4
> years since I've been there and I don't remember any statue... does
> anyone know who this is a statue of?
>

I believe it's Kusunoki Masashige, a loyalist who died fighting for an
imperial restoration in the 14th Century.
'


Tony

messages.subject: samurai statue
messages.msgSnippet: I recently got an email from someone who wants to know who the samurai statue is outside the imperial palace in tokyo in or near the gardens.  the statue is of
messages.messageBody:
I recently got an email from someone who wants to know who the
samurai statue is outside the imperial palace in tokyo in or near the
gardens. the statue is of a samurai on a horse. It's been about 4
years since I've been there and I don't remember any statue... does
anyone know who this is a statue of?

c.
